posts.post_content:
@ Elysiume, I think you are missing the point of this card. Your complaint is like saying [Banefire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Banefire) is a bad card because if you play it on turn 1 with a single mountain it does 0 damage.   
  
Cards like this take finesse and timing that something simple like an efficant but basic card like Savanna lion does not require.  
  
Sadly the only one of these I could pick up at the local game store was in \*\*\*anese but it's a rad card for heavy discard deck, and the art is top notch.

posts.post_content: Anyone complaining something like "This card sucks since on turn 3 my opponent always has like at least 6 cards." is a moron. It's rather obvious cards like these are meant to fit the tempo of black discard. Using cheap early cards like [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress) this can easily be a 4/4 or higher by turn 3, and then probably only getting stronger as turns go by.

posts.post_content:
"OMG dis is bad 2/2 for 3 mana sux!!"
  
   
Yea, in some cases it does, but dont forget that the ability ain't a staying ability like if it came into play with -1/-1 counters on it.
  
Imagine casting it on turn 3 as a 2/2. Your opponent plays a land and a creature. It is now a 3/3. Next turn, play a land and something smilar to double Hymn to Tourarch, and it is suddenly a 7/7 that can attack.
  
This card is at least a two of in a discard deck.

posts.post_content: This card feels like a home run. posts.post_content: Ok I needed to say something in the defense of this card. This card is NOT supposed to be played fisrt turn yoyur fist turn should be if lucky dark ritual then duress then hymn to turok that gets rid of three cards in there had (hopefully some are lands. Then next turn comes around and you break down there hand even further. On third turn you can nyxathid out and he may even be a 5/5 or if extremely lucky a 7/7 you are supposed to drain there hand and control there hand size for this lovley card to work out correctly.
